reply.question: 2. If the app declares the collection of data, what type of data does it collect?

answer.full_answer: The app collects data for the AI Session Notes feature, including encrypted audio streams sent for speech-to-text, transcripts retained for 30 days, Session Notes stored in an encrypted EU data center, and information for quality controls via testing and feedback monitoring.

content: Session Notes stored in an encrypted EU data center

reply.analysis: The privacy policy details the specific types of data collected when the app declares the collection, outlining the process for the AI Session Notes feature.
reply.reference: The app collects data for the AI Session Notes feature, including encrypted audio streams sent for speech-to-text, transcripts retained for 30 days, Session Notes stored in an encrypted EU data center, and information for quality controls via testing and feedback monitoring. URL: https://www.clearly.help/privacy-policy

reply.question: 4. Can the user opt out of data collection or delete data?

answer.full_answer: Users can opt out of data collection or delete data. By disabling the feature at any time under Profile privacy settings, future sessions will not be transcribed, and users can also delete existing transcripts and notes.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy clearly states that users have the ability to opt out of data collection and delete existing data by accessing the Profile privacy settings.
reply.reference: Disable the feature any time under Profile privacy settings. Future sessions will not be transcribed; you can also delete existing transcripts and notes. URL: https://www.clearly.help/privacy-policy
